t: Prayer for Protection against the Wicked.
For the choir director. A Psalm of David.
Rescue*pn me, O Lord,*s from evil men; Preserve*ln me from violent men
Who*ln devise evil things in their*i hearts; They*ln continually stir up wars.
They*ln sharpen their tongues as a serpent; Poison*ln of a viper is under their lips. Selah.
Keep*ln me, O Lord,*s from the hands of the wicked; Preserve*ln me from violent men Who*ln have purposed to trip up my feet.
The*ln proud have hidden a trap for me, and cords; They*ln have spread a net by the wayside; They*ln have set snares for me. Selah.
I*ln said to the Lord,*s “You are my God; Give*ln ear, O Lord,*s to the voice of my supplications.
O*ln God*s the Lord, the strength of my salvation, You*ln have covered my head in the day of battle.
Do*ln not grant, O Lord,*s the desires of the wicked; Do*ln not promote his evil*i device, that*i they not*i be exalted. Selah.
“As*ln for the head of those who surround me, May*ln the mischief of their lips cover them.
May*ln burning coals fall upon them; May*ln they be cast into the fire, Into*ln deep pits from which they cannot rise.
May*ln a slanderer not be established in the earth; May*ln evil hunt the violent man speedily.”
I*ln know that the Lord*s will maintain the cause of the afflicted And*ln justice for the poor.
Surely*ln the righteous will give thanks to Your name; The*ln upright will dwell in Your presence.
